intro: Codonanthe aggregata, commonly known as the clustered codonanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, showy blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
